DataElement.preferredName: Index Date To Disease Diagnosis Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient was diagnosed with the malignant disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Index Date To Malignant Neoplasm Diagnosis Day
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A date used as a reference point for ensuing events, often a diagnosis date, or a first visit date, or the date a patient enrolled in a study._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

Concepts.definition: A date used as a reference point for ensuing events, often a diagnosis date, or a first visit date, or the date a patient enrolled in a study.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

Concepts.definition: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Priority 3 of caDSR Requests Q12018 Dictionary Updates for Review (supplement). 3.14.18 mc
